title: Zayn Malik's little sister shares new pictures from wedding day
text:
Zayn Malik’s little sister Safaa has shared pictures from her wedding (Picture: Instagram)

Zayn Malik’s 17-year-old sister Safaa married her husband Martin Tiser last month and has now shared beautiful snaps from their big day.

It’s only been a few weeks since she tied the knot, but feeling all reflective as she made a new Instagram account, Safaa filled her story with pictures from her wedding day.

The teen looked simply gorgeous in the photos that saw her wearing a stunning red wedding lehenga and gold jewellery, while her hands were adorned with an intricate Mehndi design.

She married in a traditional Nikkah ceremony, held in her hometown of Bradford, and posting a snap with her husband to kickstart her new account, Safaa thanked everyone for their congratulatory messages.

Zayn’s younger sister revealed a few days ago that she couldn’t get into her usual Instagram account, so making another, she treated fans to new pictures of her wedding that hadn’t previously been posted.

There were cute snaps of herself and Martin during the ceremony, a picture of their wedding rings and, of course, a snap of the pair’s two-tier rose-themed wedding cake.

Former 1D star Zayn didn’t feature in any of the photos and it’s not clear whether he had attended Safaa’s wedding last month.

His mum Trisha, dad Yaser and his other siblings Doniya, 28, and Waliyha, 21, were all at the wedding.

Zayn is currently living in the States and has been keeping a low-profile since splitting with ex-girlfriend Gigi Hadid in January, while his other sister Waliyha has been playing the role of both big bro and sister.

Supporting Safaa, she was seen defending her younger sibling’s decision to marry at 17.

Safaa and Martin married three days after her 17th birthday (Picture: Instagram)

It’s unclear whether Zayn had attended the wedding (Picture: Rex Features)

Safaa faced criticism over her wedding on Instagram, with some claiming she was ‘too young’ to tie the knot with boyfriend Martin.

Waliyha was quick to defend the young couple, however, and insisted they were just two people who had fallen in love and wanted to get wed.

After some criticised Safaa’s age, she hit back: ‘She’s 17 years old yes and ????? What’s wtf about it?

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘It’s there life so please tell me why ur so concerned? Hasn’t ur own marriage worked or something. [sic]’

Another claimed it was due to the family’s culture, but Waliyha responded: ‘Does it have to be a culture thing? Isn’t it normal to fall in love and get married?’

Safaa and Martin married on 16 September.
